summary: Internal FBI email chain from October 2019 discussing coordination for victim interviews and travel arrangements related to an Epstein case briefing. The emails show efforts to contact victims in Miami and NYC, track responses, and schedule interviews around the briefing date.

persons.name: Program Manager
persons.context: Author of one of the emails, coordinating victim services for the Epstein briefing, tracking victim responses and interview scheduling.

events.title: Epstein Briefing Update Coordination
events.description: Internal FBI emails coordinating travel arrangements and interview scheduling for victims related to an Epstein case briefing. Discussions include tracking victim responses from Miami and NYC.

keyFacts: The FBI's Victim Services Division (VSD) was coordinating travel and interviews for victims of Jeffrey Epstein in October 2019.
Victims were being contacted in both Miami and New York City for a briefing, with efforts to schedule interviews either the day of or day after the briefing.
The document shows systematic tracking of victim responses, including counts of victims attending, needing support, and requiring interviews.
Email correspondence indicates sensitivity around victim participation, acknowledging that some may not feel ready to attend despite outreach efforts.
The document contains confidentiality notices indicating it is internal FBI communication not to be released without authorization.
